node.title: Venezuela claims Guinness World Record for largest orchestra
node.alt: Thousands of Musicians ofÂ Venezuela's National System of Youth Orchestras and Choirs take part in a concert .
node.description: Venezuela's National System of Youth and Children's Orchestras sets a new Guinness World Record for the largest orchestra, with 8,573 musicians playing simultaneously.
node.content:
["Venezuela's National System of Youth and Children's Orchestras has set a new Guinness record for the world's largest orchestra with 8,573 musicians playing together.", "Guinness World Records in a video released Saturday announced that the musicians, all connected to the country's network of youth orchestras, earned the designation with a performance a week earlier of Tchaikovsky's Slavonic March.", "The musicians, ranging in age from 12 to 77 years, attempted the record during a patriotic concert at a military academy in the capital of Caracas.", "To set the record, more than 8,097 had to be tallied playing at the same time during a five-minute period of Tchaikovsky's piece, to beat\u00a0the 2019 record set by Russia.", "The network of orchestras \u2014\u00a0known as El Sistema, or The System \u2014\u00a0assembled some 12,000 musicians for the concert.\u00a0", "More than 250 supervisors were each assigned a group of musicians to observe during the record attempt.", "After the judges deliberated for 10\u00a0days, Guinness World Records expert Susana Reyes\u00a0announced\u00a0that the El Sistema\u00a0had been successful in setting the\u00a0new record.", "", "
Guinness World Records stipulated musicians must\u00a0be playing simultaneously without people swapping in and out, or lending their instruments to other players.(Reusters: Leonardo Fernandez Viloria/File)
", "The musicians were\u00a0congratulated by Venezuela's Information Minister Freddy Nanez and the Russian ambassador on Saturday in an address broadcast on state television.", "During the broadcast, President Nicolas Maduro showed the certificate from Guinness World Records that\u00a0recognised that El Sistema\u00a0broke the record.", "Conditions require musicians to be playing simultaneously without people swapping in and out, or lending their instruments to other players.", "El Sistema\u00a0counts some 350,000 children and youths among its ranks, playing in a network of 180 orchestras.", "Reuters/AP"]
